Class Vigenere

  • java.lang.Object
    • Vigenere
  • public class Vigenere
extends java.lang.Object
    The Vigenere class is designed to allow a user to convert text back and forth given a cypher key. This class implements the algorithm listed for a Vigenere cypher, by encoding with consecutive Caesar cyphers.

    • Method Detail

      • encode

        public java.lang.String encode​(java.lang.String Message,
                               java.lang.String key)
        The encode method is designed to take in a message and then return the message encoded by a a cypher created with the key parameter. This method uses other class methods for creating the cypher, and changing between ints and strings.
        Parameters:
        Message - The Message parameter is the message to be encoded by the method.
        key - The key parameter is the string used to generate the Vigenere key which needs to be the same length as the message.
        Returns:
        The return String is the message after being encoded by the Vigenere cypher key that was created from the key parameter.

      • decode

        public java.lang.String decode​(java.lang.String encryptedMessage,
                               java.lang.String key)
        The decode method is designed to take an encrypted message and a key to use to attempt to decode it. It returns the attempt/
        Parameters:
        encryptedMessage - The encryptedMessage string is the message the method attempts to decode.
        key - The key string is the string that is passed to the keyGeneration method to create the Vigenere key to attempt to decode.
        Returns:
        The return is the method's attempt at decoding the message after generating the Vigenere key.

      • WriteToFile

        public void WriteToFile​(java.lang.String Key)
        The WriteToFile method is used to write the key to the resource txt file. The method clears the file each time to make sure the file doesnt contain any other text.
        Parameters:
        Key - The Key string parameter is the key to be written to the file.

      • RetrieveFromFile

        public java.lang.String RetrieveFromFile​(java.lang.String Local)
        The RetrieveFromFile method is used to pull the key from a file in resources.
        Parameters:
        Local - The Local string is the parameter used to select the file in resources.
        Returns:
        The string returned is the text stored in the file.

      • StringToInts

        private int[] StringToInts​(java.lang.String text)
        The StringToInts method converts a string to an array of ints via the mapping of 0-25 goes to a-z.
        Parameters:
        text - Text is the input to be converted to a numeric string. a-z convert to 0-25. The method takes any character and replaces all the non alphabetic characters with white space.
        Returns:
        The return is an int array with all the alphabetic characters repalced with a numeric representation of a-z converting to 0-25.

      • IntsToString

        private java.lang.String IntsToString​(int[] numeratedText)
        The IntsToStrings method converts an array of integers to a string via the mapping of 0-25 goes to a-z.
        Parameters:
        numeratedText - The numeratedText parameter is passed to the method so it can convert it back to text. 0-25 converts to A-Z.
        Returns:
        The converted values are added to a character array before being returned as a string.

      • KeyGeneration

        private int[] KeyGeneration​(java.lang.String key,
                            int MessageSize)
        The KeyGeneration method creates a vigenere key for the given size message.
        Parameters:
        key - The Key parameter is the string meant to be repeated until it is the same length as the message length.
        MessageSize - The MessageSize int is used to make sure the vigenere key generated is the proper size for the message.
        Returns:
